section.title: Definition
section.para: Creates a minimal ISO image for performing system installation. This image, named boot.iso, is located in the images folder of the system repository. It can be used to boot a system from CD or DVD. Remaining installation content is then downloaded over the network from the system repository.
See the Deployment Guide for Red Hat Enterprise Linux at the Red Hat Documentation website for information on using boot.iso images.

listitem.para: BOOLEAN value specifying whether a boot.iso image should be created. The created file will be located in the "images" folder for the repository.
The enabled attribute is optional. The default value is TRUE.
